isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 6. EST Data List

svcprocinfo.para: To determine if engine systems meet operating specifications to start engine

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring Engine Systems using an EST

item.para: EST with MasterDiagnostics® software
EZ-Tech® interface cable

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: If an EST is not available, see alternate test procedures following this test.
Batteries must be fully charged before doing the following steps.

step1.para:
See "DT 466 Performance Specifications" - Appendix A or "DT 570 and HT 570 Performance Specifications"
- Appendix B for specifications, and record on Diagnostic Form.
Open D_HardStart_NoStart.ssn to monitor engine operation.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Record KOEO readings on Diagnostic Form.
Crank engine for 20 seconds and read EST to measure VBAT, RPM, ICP, EOP, EGRP, and BCP.
Record readings on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: Battery voltage must be 7 V or more. If voltage to the ECM drops below 7 V, the ECM will not remain powered up.

Note: If the battery volt (VBAT) PID is less than actual battery voltage or the EST is not communicating with the ECM, see Electronic Control Module Power (ECM PWR)
in Section 7 .
Engine cranking speed must generate the required injection control pressure to operate the fuel injectors and create required compression to ignite the fuel.

If the EST shows 0 rpm during engine cranking, the ECM may not be receiving a signal from the Crankshaft Position (CKP) sensor or Camshaft Position (CMP) sensor. The ECM will not send the fueling command to the IDM without a correct CKP or CMP signal. See CKP sensor and CMP sensor in Section 7.
If the EST indicates low or no injection control pressure, do Test 14 - "Low ICP System Pressure".
If the ICP sensor is biased high, see "ICP Sensor" in Section 7 .
If oil pressure is low, the ICP system may not be receiving enough oil.
If EGR valve is open at start-up it can disrupt the air fuel mixture enough to inhibit engine operation.

BCP values may fluctuate as much as 345 kPa (50 psi). Electromagnetic interference (EMI) or ground shift can cause an insignificant voltage shift that does not indicate a problem. If above 7 MPa (1000 psi), brake actuation may occur. If over 345 kPa (50 psi), ICP operation may be inhibited for fuel injectors.
Failed batteries
High-resistance at battery cable connections or in wiring to the ECM
Failed ECM main power relay
Blown inline fuse (in battery box) that supplies voltage to the ECM
Blown fuse in power distribution box
Electrical system malfunctions, incorrect oil, or long oil change intervals in cold ambient temperatures
No rpm indication on the EST while cranking the engine: Failed CKP sensor, CMP sensor, or circuit to the ECM. Check DTCs after cranking engine for 20 seconds.
A leak in the high-pressure oil system
Failed ICP sensor
Low oil level in the high-pressure oil reservoir
Failed IPR valve or electronic controls for the regulator
Failed high-pressure oil pump or pump drive
Failed oil pressure regulator relief valve
Failed gerotor oil pump or front cover
Failed pickup tube or gasket
Internal lube oil pressure leak
Stuck or inoperative valve
Inoperative brake shut-off valve
Failed BCP sensor
Failed BCP sensor wiring
Porosity or sand hole in high-pressure oil rail (injector oil gallery to brake oil gallery)

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring ICP using VC Gasket Breakout Harness

note.para: Do this procedure, if an EST is not available. This is an alternate method.

item.para: VC Gasket Breakout Harness
Digital Multimeter (DMM)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para:
See "DT 466 Performance Specifications" - Appendix A or "DT 570 and HT 570 Performance Specifications"
- Appendix B and Section 7 for specifications, operational voltages, and values. Record on Diagnostic Form.

calloutgroup.callout1: Front of engine
Pass-through connector for BCP sensor
Pass-through connector for brake shut-off valve
Pass-through connector for ICP sensor

step1.para: Disconnect engine harness connector from pass-through connector for ICP sensor.

figure.caption: VC Gasket Breakout Harness connector to pass-through connector for ICP sensor

step1.para: Connect VC Gasket Breakout Harness to pass-through connector and engine harness.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Use DMM to measure injection control pressure (ICP signal voltage) KOEO.

item.para: Connect POS to green (signal circuit) and NEG to black (signal ground).

step1.para: Record KOEO reading on Diagnostic Form.
Take another measurement while cranking the engine for 20 seconds.
Record reading on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If ICP voltage is out of specification at KOEO only, see "ICP Sensor" in Section 7 .
If ICP voltage is out of specification at engine crank only, do Test 14 - "Low ICP System Pressure".
If ICP voltage is in specification at KOEO and builds to cranking voltage during engine crank, continue to "Monitoring BCP using VC Gasket Breakout Harness" test

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring BCP using VC Gasket Breakout Harness

note.para: Do this procedure, if an EST is not available. This is an alternate method.

item.para: VC Gasket Breakout Harness
Digital Multimeter (DMM)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

note.para: BCP should be zero, when engine brake is inactive. BCP values may fluctuate as much as 50 psi. Electromagnetic Interference (EMI) or ground shift can cause an insignificant voltage shift that does not indicate a problem. This should be equal to KOEO BCP signal voltage.

step1.para:
See "DT 466 Performance Specifications" - Appendix A or "DT 570 and HT 570 Performance Specifications"
- Appendix B and Section 7 for specifications, operational voltages, and values. Record on Diagnostic Form.

calloutgroup.callout1: Front of engine
Pass-through connector for BCP sensor
Pass-through connector for brake shut-off valve
Pass-through connector for ICP sensor

step1.para: Disconnect engine harness connector from the pass-through connector for the BCP sensor.

figure.caption: VC Gasket Breakout Harness to pass-through connector for BCP sensor

step1.para: Connect VC Gasket Breakout Harness to pass-through connector and engine harness.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Use DMM to measure brake control pressure (BCP signal voltage) KOEO.

item.para: Connect POS to green (signal circuit) and NEG to black (signal ground).

step1.para: Record KOEO reading on Diagnostic Form.
Take another measurement while cranking engine for 20 seconds.
Record reading on Diagnostic Form and compare KOEO reading.

item.para: If BCP cranking signal voltage is significantly more than KOEO BCP signal voltage, when engine brake is inactive, diagnose BCP sensor, circuit, and engine brake components.
If BCP cranking signal voltage is equal to KOEO BCP, signal voltage BCP is not a problem.

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring EOP at EOT Sensor Port

note.para: Do this procedure, if an EST is not available. This is an alternate method.

item.para: Gauge bar (0 - 160 psi gauge)
ICP system test adapter (VT 365)
Test hose assembly
Socket or wrench (EOT sensor removal and installation)

figure.caption: ICP test adapter and test hose assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: ICP system test adapter
Test hose assembly

figure.caption: Test hose connection to 0 - 160 psi gauge

calloutgroup.callout1: 0 - 160 psi gauge
Test hose connection

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para:
See "DT 466 Performance Specifications" - Appendix A or "DT 570 and HT 570 Performance Specifications"
- Appendix B and Section 7 for specifications, operational voltages, and values. Record on Diagnostic Form.
Make a test hose that will connect the ICP system test adapter to the gauge bar or equivalent gauge.
Connect test hose to ICP adapter.

Remove the EOT sensor from the front cover. Oil will spill out. Catch oil in container. Quickly install ICP system adapter and test hose assembly. Position hose so oil will not drain out.
If oil does not spill out of the EOT port, oil supply is the problem.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line, do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect test hose to gauge bar (0-160 psi gauge) or equivalent gauge.
Crank engine for 20 seconds and monitor EOP.
Record pressure on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If oil pressure is below specification, diagnose lube oil pressure system, see Section 4 - "Engine Symptoms Diagnostics" .

If oil pressure is at specification, remove test hose and gauge bar. Quickly remove ICP system adapter and test hose assembly. Oil will spill out. Catch oil in container and install EOT sensor. Follow the procedure in Engine Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring Engine Systems using Breakout Box

note.para: Do this procedure, if an EST is not available. This is an alternate method.

item.para: Breakout Box
Digital Multimeter (DMM)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para:
See "DT 466 Performance Specifications" - Appendix A or "DT 570 and HT 570 Performance Specifications"
- Appendix B and Section 7 for specifications, operational voltages, and values. Record on Diagnostic Form.
Turn the ignition switch to OFF and ensure all accessories are turned off.
Remove X1, X2 and X3, X4 connectors from ECM.

figure.caption: Engine and chassis breakout box connections

calloutgroup.callout1: Breakout box connector X4 to ECM
Breakout box connector X3 to ECM
Breakout box connector X2 to ECM
Breakout box connector X1 to ECM
Engine wiring harness ECM connector X2 to breakout box header
Engine wiring harness ECM connector X1 to breakout box header
Breakout box header X1 and X2 engine to breakout box
Chassis wiring harness connector to breakout box header
Chassis wiring harness connector to breakout box header
Breakout box header X3 and X4 breakout box to chassis

step1.para: Connect breakout box connectors X1, X2 and X3, X4 to ECM.
Connect wiring harness connectors to breakout box headers X1, X2 and X3, X4.
Connect DMM leads to breakout box.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Use DMM to measure KOEO values for the following:

item.para: V BAT (DMM set to DC V)
POS X3-3 to NEG X3-7 (V IGN Pwr)
POS X4-1 to NEG X3-6 (ECM PWR)
POS X4-2 to NEG X3-7 (ECM PWR)
rpm (DMM set to DC mV Hz)
POS X1-1 to NEG X3-7 (CKP)
rpm (DMM set to DC mV rpm 2)
POS X1-9 to NEG X3-7 (CMP)
ICP (DMM set to DC V)
POS X1-20 to NEG X1-6
EOP (DMM set to DC V)
POS X2-7 to NEG X1-6
BCP (DMM set to DC V)
POS X2 -11 to NEG X1- 6

step1.para: Record KOEO reading on Diagnostic Form.
Take another measurement while cranking engine for 20 seconds.

item.para:
If ECM voltage is below specification, see "Electronic Control Module Power (ECM PWR)"
in Section 7 .
If CKP DCmV Hz is not in specification during crank, see "CKP Sensor" in Section 7 .
If CMP DCmV RPM2 is not in specification during crank, see "CMP Sensor" in Section 7 .
If EOP is not in specification during crank, see "Low Oil Pressure" in Section 4 .
If BCP is not in specification during crank, see "BCP" Sensor" in Section 7 .
If all measurements are in specification, continue with the next diagnostic test.

step1.para: Record readings on Diagnostic Form.
